events.originalText: Riots in four Ecuadorian prisons caused by gang rivalies resulted in the deaths of 79 inmates.
events.subtitle: February 2021 Ecuadorian prison riots
events.headline: 79 inmates killed in Ecuadorian prison riots

events.originalText: Syrian civil war: Allied troops led by the Turkish Armed Forces captured the city of al-Bab from the Islamic State.
events.subtitle: Syrian civil war
events.headline: Turkish Armed Forces capture al-Bab from Islamic State

events.originalText: A B-2 Spirit stealth bomber crashed on the runway shortly after takeoff from Andersen Air Force Base in Guam in the most expensive crash in U.S. Air Force history.
events.subtitle: Northrop Grumman B-2 Spirit
events.headline: B-2 Spirit stealth bomber crashes in Guam

events.originalText: Light from SN 1987A, a supernova in the Large Magellanic Cloud, reached the Earth.
events.subtitle: SN 1987A
events.headline: Light from SN 1987A supernova reaches Earth

events.originalText: Vietnam War: South Vietnamese General Đỗ Cao Trí was killed in a helicopter crash en route to taking control of the faltering Operation Lam Son 719.
events.subtitle: Vietnam War
events.headline: South Vietnamese General killed in helicopter crash

events.originalText: Second World War: An Allied bombing run on Pforzheim, Germany, killed approximately 31 percent of its population and destroyed about 83 percent of its buildings.
events.subtitle: World War II
events.headline: Allied bombing run kills 31% of Pforzheim population

events.originalText: American photographer Joe Rosenthal took the Pulitzer Prize–winning photograph Raising the Flag on Iwo Jima (pictured) during the Battle of Iwo Jima, an image that was later reproduced on the Marine Corps War Memorial.
events.subtitle: Joe Rosenthal
events.headline: Joe Rosenthal wins Pulitzer Prize for Iwo Jima photo

events.originalText: In response to an insurgency in Chechnya, the Soviet Union began the forced deportation of native Chechen and Ingush of North Caucasus to Kazakhstan and Kyrgyzstan.
events.subtitle: 1940–1944 insurgency in Chechnya
events.headline: Soviet Union deports Chechen and Ingush to Kazakhstan and Kyrgyzstan

events.originalText: 35 children and 1 adult employee were killed in a fire at an orphanage in the town of Cavan, Ireland.
events.subtitle: Cavan Orphanage fire
events.headline: 35 children and 1 adult killed in Cavan orphanage fire

events.originalText: Plutonium was first chemically identified by chemist Glenn T. Seaborg and his team at the University of California, Berkeley.
events.subtitle: Plutonium
events.headline: Plutonium chemically identified by Glenn T. Seaborg

events.originalText: Plutonium was first chemically identified by chemist Glenn T. Seaborg and his team at the University of California, Berkeley.
events.subtitle: Plutonium
events.headline: Charles Martin Hall discovers method to produce aluminium

events.originalText: American inventor Charles Martin Hall discovered an inexpensive method of producing aluminium.
events.subtitle: Charles Martin Hall
events.headline: Orange River Convention signed, recognizing Orange Free State independence

events.originalText: The Orange River Convention was signed in Bloemfontein, with Britain agreeing to recognise the independence of the Orange Free State in present-day South Africa.
events.subtitle: Orange River Convention
events.headline: US Army repulses Mexican army at Battle of Buena Vista

events.originalText: Mexican–American War: The United States Army used artillery to repulse the much larger Mexican army at the Battle of Buena Vista near Saltillo.
events.subtitle: Mexican–American War
events.headline: Friedrich Wilhelm von Steuben volunteers for Continental Army

events.originalText: American Revolutionary War: Prussian military officer Friedrich Wilhelm von Steuben arrived at Valley Forge in Pennsylvania as a volunteer for the Continental Army.
events.subtitle: American Revolutionary War
events.headline: Dick Turpin's identity uncovered by former schoolmate

events.originalText: The identity of English highwayman Dick Turpin was uncovered by his former schoolmate, who recognised his handwriting, leading to Turpin's trial.
events.subtitle: Highwayman
